intro: Comes, commonly known as the common comes plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant produces pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. The botanical features of Comes make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
